excerpt: this took FOREVER, you can probably tell by the constant change in style, but it went really well!!!!! also, i wasn't able to edit this because my life is he...
description:
this took me SO HECKING LONG, but it turned out good, so I’m proud.

I spent hours listening to sneezes and little things in the background to figure out which one of them sniffled. I don’t know what to do with this power

[captions in video]

[ID: the video is a hand drawn back and white animatic of the scene]

Latest obsessions:
- The Adventure Zone Amnesty
Watching:
- The Dragon Prince
Playing:
- Kingdom Hearts III
Reading:
- Percy Jackson series

summary: hmmm the beau and caleb conversation is fuCKING ME UP MY PALS I caught the tail end of it live when they’re talking about...
body:
hmmm the beau and caleb conversation is fuCKING ME UP MY PALS

I caught the tail end of it live when they’re talking about Caleb’s uncertainty re: Nott, and it hit so so many nerves re: aroace existential fears of when your closest friends get distant from you once they get romantic partners, and the terror of the looming loneliness growing as you get older and this happens again and again and again

Even Beau couldn’t fully reassure him, downgrading her “you’ll always be partners” to “you’ll always have the memories of the times you were partners.”

But what I didn’t realize is I missed the first part of this conversation, where Beau had just. Flat-out said “if you end up in hell I’ll be there with you.”  That changes everything about this conversation.  He isn’t going to be left alone or unsupported even if his place in Nott’s life has changed.  Even the very fact that he could share these fears with Beau shows that.  The fear is so viscerally, painfully relatable, but the best antidote is to pause and look around at the people who are still there for you.

But what I didn’t realize is I missed the first part of this conversation, where Beau had just. Flat-out said “if you end up in hell I’ll be there with you.”  That changes everything about this conversation.  He isn’t going to be left alone or unsupported even if his place in Nott’s life has changed.  Even the very fact that he could share these fears with Beau shows that.  The fear is so viscerally, painfully relatable, but the best antidote is to pause and look around at the people who are still there for you.

Even Beau couldn’t fully reassure him, downgrading her “you’ll always be partners” to “you’ll always have the memories of the times you were partners.”

But what I didn’t realize is I missed the first part of this conversation, where Beau had just. Flat-out said “if you end up in hell I’ll be there with you.”  That changes everything about this conversation.  He isn’t going to be left alone or unsupported even if his place in Nott’s life has changed.  Even the very fact that he could share these fears with Beau shows that.  The fear is so viscerally, painfully relatable, but the best antidote is to pause and look around at the people who are still there for you.

I caught the tail end of it live when they’re talking about Caleb’s uncertainty re: Nott, and it hit so so many nerves re: aroace existential fears of when your closest friends get distant from you once they get romantic partners, and the terror of the looming loneliness growing as you get older and this happens again and again and again

Even Beau couldn’t fully reassure him, downgrading her “you’ll always be partners” to “you’ll always have the memories of the times you were partners.”

But what I didn’t realize is I missed the first part of this conversation, where Beau had just. Flat-out said “if you end up in hell I’ll be there with you.”  That changes everything about this conversation.  He isn’t going to be left alone or unsupported even if his place in Nott’s life has changed.  Even the very fact that he could share these fears with Beau shows that.  The fear is so viscerally, painfully relatable, but the best antidote is to pause and look around at the people who are still there for you.

summary: beau and caleb’s conversations fucking me up as usual caleb getting all existential and confiding in her that he expects to go...
body:
beau and caleb’s conversations fucking me up as usual

caleb getting all existential and confiding in her that he expects to go to [inesrt fantasy hell if it exists] and the way her face crumples when she realizes what he’s saying

and how when she realizes that her dismissal of it is not sinking in she switches to a “well I’d be there with you” mY HEART……..

blog.description: I write and reblog things for my fandoms. Main focus Critical Role. Feel free to send me asks or general headcanons about characters! I have a critical role rp blog! made and role played for Yeza the halfling (chemistyeza.tumblr.com). Asks open!

summary: How d'you think it'll go down once it comes out that Jester was the one who stole Nott's flask?
question: How d'you think it'll go down once it comes out that Jester was the one who stole Nott's flask?
answer:
Nott trusted her, she super completely trusted her. 

She won’t trust her as much anymore, yelling will probably happen, and Nott’s whole panic attack and downward spiral of being terrified will amplify and she will either die or leave. 

Im pessimistic though, and always think of the worst case scenario because of my catastrophic thinking that a therapist said I do. Maybe I’m wrong, maybe I’m right and we get to meet the character Sam is so jazzed about. 

I’m happy to watch either way.

summary: “The laughing hand, timeless and seeking the torment of all, the undying chosen” is what the celestial skull said they sealed...
body:
• “The laughing hand, timeless and seeking the torment of all, the undying chosen” is what the celestial skull said they sealed away
  • the “Undying” is a warlock subclass, and Fjord/Vandran/Avantika have been referred to as Uku’toa’s “chosen”
  • A lot of this tomb junk seems reminiscent of the worm that was next to Uku’toa in the mural under the temple of the False Serpent

The eldritch plot thickens

summary:
~the boys are back in town~
{like/rb if you use. feel free to use them! that’s why i made them! please credit me if you do...
body:
~the boys are back in town~

{like/rb if you use. feel free to use them! that’s why i made them! please credit me if you do use!

[image description: 6 critical role icons. from top left to bottom right: fjord (a half-orc man who’s skin goes from a dark, forest green on the top of his face to a lighter green towards the bottom. he has a lip scar on the right side of his mouth and two eyebrow scars on his right eyebrow. his hair is black and short), caduceus (a pale firbolg with bright pink hair. his features resemble a cow. his eyes are pink and he has a pink, short beard), caleb (a dirty human male. he has long, ginger hair and blue eyes. he has some facial hair and is very dirty), frumpkin (a bengal cat. he is somewhat ginger with brown stripes. he has yellow eyes), mollymauk (a purple tiefling. he has long purple hair, red eyes, and pierced horns. he has scars on his collarbones and a peacock feather that steams from below his collar, upward), and shakaste (a dark skinned human male. eyes and hair are white, his hair having different beads in it. he has a long, thin, white beard as well).
